arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss Jones on 3-0 win over Exeter City: We dominated from start to finish
arts.sum: Tyreece Campbell struck an excellent second from the edge of the area after the interval with Miles Leaburn’s close-range finish reflecting the dominance of the South Londoners, who are only outside of the League One play-offs on goal difference. Nathan Jones was feeling very satisfied after Charlton Athletic’s 3-0 win over Exeter City today.

arts.ttl: Charlton continue strong home form with comfortable win over Exeter
arts.sum: The play-off hopefuls have now won five successive games in front of their own fans.

arts.ttl: Exeter City taking confidence into their trip to Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: “I say it a lot about our defending and clean sheets, it is the foundation to winning football matches and building that consistency of results, so to win and win the way we did in terms of the fight, the team spirit, the togetherness was brilliant,” Caldwell said. “We have to build some form and build some consistency in the league,” Caldwell said reflecting on that win and ahead of today’s trip to Charlton Athletic.

arts.ttl: Exeter City will hold investigation after Ilmari Niskanen's criminal charge
arts.sum: Niskanen, who featured in Exeter’s 1-0 win at Cambridge United last week - and in the heroic FA Cup penalty shoot-out loss to Premier League side Nottingham Forest - has shown great remorse for his actions and released a statement. Devon and Cornwall Police said Niskanen, who joined the Grecians on an undisclosed fee from Dundee United in August 2023 and has made 69 appearances for the club, had been charged with the offence on the A30 near Honiton on Thursday, February 6.

arts.ttl: Exeter City Women back at home and looking for a win
arts.sum: Back-to-back away games in the South East yielded three points for Abbie Britton's side, as a good win against Billericay was followed up by a cruel late defeat at league leaders Ipswich Town. AFC Wimbledon have had a steady first season to date, victories over Cheltenham Town, Milton Keynes, Watford, Billericay Town, Oxford United and Gwalia United confirming a comfortable sixth position in the current league table.

arts.ttl: Lloyd Jones on hard summer graft paying off after strong campaign for Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: Lloyd Jones has pinpointed having a strong pre-season under his belt as a big factor in his impressive displays for Charlton Athletic. “I was injured towards the back end of last season and I had a big chat with the manager, probably the last week of it, and he basically said: ‘Don’t tell me what you’re going to do – prove it’.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic man to miss Exeter City clash due to injury
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic goalkeeper Ashley Maynard-Brewer will miss their game this weekend due to injury, as per a report… The post Charlton Athletic man to miss Exeter City clash due to injury appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Lloyd Jones: Charlton’s confidence not dented by defeat to Birmingham - we have great chance of making play-offs
arts.sum: Lloyd Jones is adamant that Charlton Athletic’s defeat at Birmingham City last weekend will not dent their confidence as they look to move back into the League One play-off places. Jones said: “Our focus is just on the preparation going into the next game.

arts.ttl: Everyone at Exeter City should take great pride in FA Cup performance
arts.sum: Certainly, we didn’t show the visitors too much respect, and started the game really positively – going ahead when their keeper, Carlos Miguel, gifted Josh Magennis a goal inside the opening five minutes. I thought we did fantastically to survive another 30 minutes with just 10 men and when the game went to penalties, like everyone else, I dared to dream.

arts.ttl: Preview: Charlton Athletic vs. Exeter City - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Charlton Athletic and Exeter City, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
